intro: Calyxhymenia ovata, commonly known as the oval calyx plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, ovate-shaped calyx that persists on the fruit. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptical, and often have a hairy texture. Calyxhymenia ovata produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
